oai_dc:dc.dc:title: School food provision in Germany. A first analysis of the role of organic produce
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Strassner, Carola
Nölting, Benjamin
Reimann, Silke
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
Food systems
Policy environments and social economy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: School meal provision in Germany is changing from a type of supplementary food provision towards full warm school meals. Reasons for this transition are longer school days, the expansion of the all-day school model, and an increasing interest in a healthy nutrition for children and young people. However, the organisation of school meal systems is patchy and confusing; there is an enormous range of services in various qualities. This paper describes the current situation and explores chances for sustainable school meal systems emerging out of this change. The focus is on the use of organic food in school meals.
